intro: Klasea mucronata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf klasea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its small, yellow flowers are surrounded by pale green bracts, and it produces small, dry fruits called cypsela. Klasea mucronata is often found in fynbos vegetation and is adapted to the Mediterranean climate of the region.
